intro: Agoseris gaspensis, commonly known as Gaspé's agoseris, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of eastern North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils along the shores of the Atlantic coast. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer to early fall. Agoseris gaspensis is often found in maritime habitats and is adapted to withstand salt spray and coastal winds.
